```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

## By default reticulate creates virtualenvs in ~/.virtualenv
## To change where the virtualenv is created we have to use
## the WORKON_HOME environment variable
Sys.setenv(WORKON_HOME = ".")

## Create the virtualenv
reticulate::virtualenv_install(
  envname = "venv",
  python = Sys.which("python3.8"),
  packages = c("gcsa",
               "google",
               "matplotlib",
               "numpy",
               "pandas")
)

## Activate the virtualenv
reticulate::use_virtualenv("./venv")
Sys.setenv("RETICULATE_PYTHON" = file.path("./venv", "bin", "python"))
```

```{python python-imports, echo=FALSE}
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from base import Timesheet
```

```{python echo=FALSE}
plt.style.use("ggplot")
sheet = Timesheet()
```

```{python echo=FALSE, results='asis'}
print(f"Current Status: {sheet.status}")
```

## Last 5 days

```{python echo=FALSE, results='asis'}
days = 5
summary = sheet.summarise(n=days)
for key, value in summary.items():
    print(f"### {key}: {value} Hours")
```

## Last 30 days

```{python echo=FALSE, results='asis'}
days = 30
summary = sheet.summarise(n=days)
for key, value in summary.items():
    print(f"### {key}: {value} Hours")
```

```{python echo=FALSE}
fig, ax = sheet.hist(days)
plt.show()
```
